titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 173: Ziyārat-i ʻĀshūrāʼ.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 173: Ziyārat-i ʻĀshūrāʼ. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Columbia University, Rare Book & Manuscript Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book and Manuscript Library MS Or 173: Ziyārat-i ʻĀshūrāʼ.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: Book of prayers to say during visits to sacred sites including during the ʻĀshūrā pilgrimage, when visiting the grave of al-Ḥusayn ibn ʻAlī. Prayers in Arabic with Persian instruction and some translation.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Naskh for the Arabic and nastaʻlīq for some Persian; black ink, pointed with Arabic vocalized.

decoDesc.decoNote: Gold and polychrome illuminated headpiece (f. 1v). Border-rules in red, gold, blue; page-frame ruled in black; lines ruled in gold. Rubrications in red and blue.

binding.p: Lacquer binding with red, orange and black designs. Purple paper doublure.

origin.p: Item not dated, likely copied in the mid-18th to mid-19th century.

history.provenance: Customs stamp dated 1312/1894-95 (f. 1r, 85v) and an undated customs stamp (f. 85v). Owner's stamp (f. 1r).

keywords.term: Muslim pilgrims and pilgrimages--Iraq--Karbalāʼ--Early works to 1800
